page.title: 13Interview - Doctors
page.content: The practice looks after 5,500 people of whom the Doctors treat about 100 patients each week.All the Doctors enjoy their jobs but did admit to disliking 'calls' in the middle of the night.Dr Swales has practised for 29 years,Dr McMahon for 11 years, Dr Wyatt for 10 years. Each Doctor works for one third of the working week. They declared that the commonest illness that they treated was a cough and one of the rarest illnesses that they had dealt with was Guillaine _ Barre. They studied at Cambridge and Sheffield and they have worked else where in London, Leicester and Rotherham.
